contents.item: Because, once alone, it is impossible to believe that one could ever have been otherwise. Loneliness is an absolute discovery.

In spite of language, in spite of intelligence and intuition and sympathy, one can never really communicate anything to anybody. The essential substance of every thought and feeling remains incommunicable, locked up in the impenetrable strong-room of the individual soul and body. Our life is a sentence of perpetual solitary confinement.
Lonely was much better than alone.

contents.item: When so many are lonely as seem to be lonely, it would be inexcusably selfish to be lonely alone.

contents.item: When I'm in turmoil, when I can't think, when I'm exhausted and afraid and feeling very, very alone, I go for walks. It's just one of those things I do. I walk and I walk and sooner or later something comes to me, something to make me feel less like jumping off a building.
Loneliness is about the scariest thing out there.

There's lots of good fish in the sea... maybe... but the vast masses seem to be mackerel or herring, and if you're not mackerel or herring yourself, you are likely to find very few good fish in the sea.
